description.narrative: Basic Services for the Vulnerable aims to support Iraq's transition to a stable, economically prosperous nation by ensuring poor and marginalised Iraqis have access to basic services such as shelter and education. Planned activities include working with the: Danish Refugee Council to improve access to livelihood opportunities for female headed households through the provision of vocational education and training; International Rescue Committee (IRC) to provide safe and healing learning for marginalized and conflict-affected children and youth through increasing access to quality education opportunities by supporting 31 basic and accelerated learning schools; and the United Nations High Commission for Refugees to provide protection and assistance to internally displaced persons by providing shelter to 409,000 people living in destitute conditions. The total value of this initiative is $10.2 million over 2 years, starting 2011-12.
